Controls.Description: HDInsight must have supported HDI cluster version
Controls.Rationale: Being on the latest/supported HDInsight version significantly reduces risks from security bugs or updates that may be present in older or retired cluster versions.

Controls.Description: Use Public-Private key pair together with a passcode for SSH login
Controls.Rationale: Public-Private key pair help to protect against password guessing and brute force attacks

Controls.Description: HDInsight cluster access must be restricted using virtual network or Azure VPN gateway service with NSG traffic rules
Controls.Rationale: Restricting cluster access with inbound and outbound traffic via NSGs limits the network exposure for cluster and reduces the attack surface.
Controls.Recommendation: You should restrict IP range and port as per application needs. Refer: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/hdinsight/hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network

Controls.Description: Secure transfer protocol must be used for accessing storage account resources
Controls.Rationale: Use of secure transfer ensures server/service authentication and protects data in transit from network layer man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, session-hijacking attacks. When enabling HTTPS one must remember to simultaneously disable access over plain HTTP else data can still be subject to compromise over clear text connections.

Controls.Description: Storage used for cluster must have encryption at rest enabled
Controls.Rationale: Using this feature ensures that sensitive data is stored encrypted at rest. This minimizes the risk of data loss from physical theft and also helps meet regulatory compliance requirements.

Controls.Description: Sensitive data must be stored on storage linked to cluster and not on cluster node disks
Controls.Rationale: Cluster node restart may cause loss of data present on cluster nodes. Also currently HDInsight does not support encryption at rest for cluster node disk.
Controls.Recommendation: All data must be stored on storage linked with HDInsight cluster

Controls.Description: Access to cluster's storage must be restricted to virtual network of the cluster
Controls.Rationale: Restricting storage access within cluster network boundary reduces the attack surface.

Controls.Description: All users/identities must be granted minimum required cluster operation permissions using Ambari Role Based Access Control (RBAC)
Controls.Rationale: Granting minimum access by leveraging RBAC feature ensures that users are granted just enough permissions to perform their tasks. This minimizes exposure of the resources in case of user/service account compromise.

Controls.Description: Only required users/identities must be granted access to Ambari views
Controls.Rationale: Granting access to only required users to Ambari views ensures minimum exposure of underline data resources.

Controls.Description: Ambari admin password must be renewed after a regular interval
Controls.Rationale: Periodic key/password rotation is a good security hygiene practice as, over time, it minimizes the likelihood of data loss/compromise which can arise from key theft/brute forcing/recovery attacks.

Controls.Description: Diagnostics must be enabled for cluster operations
Controls.Rationale: Diagnostics logs are needed for creating activity trail while investigating an incident or a compromise.
